product.question: How do I scan slides?
product.answer: You can scan slides using the JE Transparency Adapter (part number STA8901) available from Jackson Electronics.
product.question: Where can I find the latest drivers for my ScanMaster?
product.answer: You can download the latest software drivers from the Jackson Electronics Web page.
product.question: What is the largest sheet that I can scan?
How do I fax with my ScanMaster?
product.answer: You can turn your scanner into a fax machine by purchasing the FaxRight add-on component (part number STA4500) available from Jackson Electronics.

product.question: What is the difference between optical and digital zoom?
product.answer: With optical zoom, the Digicam's lens physically moves inside the camera; with digital zoom, the camera's processor zooms the image electronically. If you zoom too much, your image will become pixelated.
product.question: What sort of batteries should I use with the DigiCam?
product.answer: Nickel metal hydride (NiMH) batteries work the best and have the longest lifetime. Nickel-cadium batteries also work very well, as do alkaline batteries. Do not use lithium batteries.
product.question: What resolution should I use for 4×6-inch photos?
product.answer: We recommend 640×480 for 4×6-inch images, 1024×768 for 5×7-inch photos, and 1600×1200 for 8×10-inch photos.
product.question: Can the DigiCam be harmed by airport X-ray machines?
product.answer: No, there is no evidence that X-ray machines can affect the performance of the DigiCam or the quality of DigiCam photos.
